RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 13750. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 21, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SAINT KENNEDY broke sharp, settled off of the pace and stalked from the five path, rated patiently until given the cue at the five sixteenths pole, edged further out into the seven path and launched a bid, battled with and inside foe, matched strides clear down the stretch and got up for the win just in time. MARY JACK stalked the pace setter from the three path, shifted out into the four path at the half mile pole, started to gain ground in the turn, had control of the race at the five sixteenth pole, was challenged by an outside rival in the upper stretch, battled down the lane but came up short and had to settle for second place. WENDY WILECAT was off slow, steadied early on, saved ground while racing inside of another horse, made a mild bid late, up for third. SUFFRAGETTE wide trip, no rally. BEAUTIFULANDWILD had and awkward start and settled along the rail mid pack, she maintained that position but was never really involved. ROYAL BONUS showed early speed and took the lead while racing along the rail, controlled the pace until the three eighths pole, where she was challenged by two outside rivals, battled briefly in the upper stretch but gave way at the sixteenth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Bonus
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, set pace, rail, challenged 1/4, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Wendy Wilecat
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow start, steadied, inside, closed late

ENTRY.NAME: Mary Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3p, inside, 4p bid 1/2, led 1/4, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Saint Kennedy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w,5w,7w upper, challenged 1/4, battled, up in time

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Pope McLean, Marc McLean & Pope McLeanJr.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 84. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 21, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000, if for $17,500, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inad visable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LILLIE DELL broke sharp and took advantage of her post position, took the early lead and attended the pace, gained ground and gained momentum and built up her lead the further she went and was uncontested winner. SUMMER LIGHTNING settled off the pace on the inside, was asked at the three eighths pole where she responded and started to gain ground, closed the gap between her an d the eventual winner, shifted out at the quarter pole into the six path, chased the winner to the wire but was second best today. LA SMOOCHIE raced from off the pace, stayed near the fence and saved ground through out, was able to gain ground moving up along the rail in the turn and finished well. BLUEBIRD SING shuffled back early, shifted into the three path and saved ground while finding her stride, found room on the rail and advanced along the fence past the three eighths pole and into the stretch, drifted out into the seven path in mid stretch but closed well. FOLLOW THE SAINT was off a bit slow, angled down into the three path, raced at her own pace until after the half mile pole where she launched a long bid gaining ground and closing, had clear running room on the rail and saved ground as she entered the stretch, closed well but to no avail today. ALYS EPISODE raced in the second tier three wide while she was stalking the pace, was well placed while moving into the lane but tired mid stretch. STILL OF THE NIGHT was well off the pace early while racing in the three path, maintained position and showed little. SUZY DOLL'S READY raced three wide in the middle of the field, was in contention at the seven sixteenth marker, drifted out in the turn. DERBY DAY LASSIE stalked the early leaders, raced three wide, launched a bid then faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Lillie Dell
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, rail, set pace, loose on the lead

ENTRY.NAME: Summer Lightning
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack inside, asked 3/8, 6 wide upper, drifted, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: La Smoochie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, saved ground, improved position, up for third

ENTRY.NAME: Bluebird Sing
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back, 3p, moved 1/2, rail, advanced 3/8, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Follow the Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Thornton Joe and Cascio Andrew J
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, settled far back, one run, no avail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.

CLAIM.OWNER: Ramirez Racing and Juarez Munoz Juan Carlos

RACE.FOOTNOTES: CURLIN EDGES was three wide while stalking the pace from mid pack, raced in between horses and gained ground after the half mile pole, joined the leaders on the outside at the seven sixteenth pole, was cued at the three eighths pole and advanced, cleared the early leader at the quarter pole, then angled down into the two path, was briefly threatened by an outside challenger, but puled away and was the winner. BELLA'S GATSBY raced mid pack, saved ground early, shifted out four wide at the three eights pole, gained ground from the outside, was well placed by the quarter pole, launched a bid and drew close to the eventual winner by the sixteenth but came up short and had to settle for second. DEPUTY KNIGHT stalked the early leader while racing in the two path, advanced to challenge by the three eighths pole, took the lead briefly, surrendered the lead at he quarter pole and retreated. ROSIE'S BOY raced off the pace, made no impact. PLAY MASTER was off a tough slow and passed tired rivals. MO HAWK MAN brief speed, faltered. HOWL YEAH was off slow and made no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Curlin Edges
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, mid pack, in between, matched, bid 3/8, led 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Howl Yeah
ENTRY.OWNER: Smith Mike Smith Daria and East Austin Racing Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Bella's Gatsby
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, saved ground, shifted out 4w, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy Knight
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2p, briefly led, caught broke slowly, the 1/4

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 13750. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 21, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 21, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,5 00.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TURN ON THE MAGIC raced from off the pace in the two path, advanced at the half mile pole with pressure from two outside foes, challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, was matching strides with the early leaders at the quarter pole in the four path, took the lead by the sixteenth pole and edged clear of the rest for the win. OKUDAH took the lead while being rated along the rail, was joined after the half by outside rivals, was challenged for the lead at the seven sixteenths pole and battled into the stretch, where he gave way and settled for second. TEMPRANO was well off the pace early, smartly saved ground while racing on the rail, gained momentum with every stride, closed well and was up for third. EGO raced just off the pace, moved along side of leading rivals at the half, maintained position through the turn, was in contention at the quarter pole then faded late. EUROEXIT raced off the pace, drew next to the early leaders while in between horses at the half, then gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Euroexit
ENTRY.COMMENT: off the pace, advanced 1/2, pressured, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Ego
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 5w, matched 1/2, in contention 1/4, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Turn On the Magic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 2nd tier, 3w, bid 1/2, pressured, 4wupper, cleared, up

ENTRY.NAME: Okudah
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, saved ground, battled, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M Turf CR: 81. Allowance Purse 28000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since A pril 21, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MADAM HENNY showed speed, shuffled back into mid pack while racing three wide, launched a bid at the three eights pole, was six wide in the upper stretch and closing, cleared the rest by the sixteenth pole and drew off for the win. HUSHED COURT ROOM stalked from the four path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, drew along side of the early leader at the quarter pole, battled and faltered late. MY ALIBI raced from well off the pace and was unhurried early on, settled along the rail and saved ground, was put in contention at the five sixteenth pole, angled out into the five path in the stretch, was gaining ground with every stride while closing fast but ran out of racing room and settled for third today. Raced a game race though. CHROME SAVAGE raced off the pace, saved ground, made one run, closed well. ROYA was off the pace early, launched a mild bid racing in the six path, was in contention at the top of the lane but to no avail. DEROUTANTE raced from off the pace in the five path launched a mild bid at the three eighths pole, but made no impact. WATCH THIS MUNNY had early speed and willing took the lead, attended to the pace into the stretch, then tired. FADED MEMORIES raced mid pack while saving ground, moved into contention up the fence after the half, had to slightly check going into the tun and was no factor after that. MARCIAMARCIAMARCIA flashed early speed, retreated. ABBY THE BULL DAWG was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: My Alibi
ENTRY.OWNER: Salome Robert Joseph and Salome Dana
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, edged out upper, closed,

ENTRY.NAME: Faded Memories
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, saved ground, checked slightly 3/8, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Chrome Savage
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Abby the Bull Dawg
ENTRY.OWNER: Wood David and Dunn John Michael

ENTRY.NAME: Watch This Munny
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, led, attended to the pace, tired late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 35000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 21, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORT POLK stalked the leader from the three path, challenged for the lead at the half mile pole, cleared the field at the five sixteenth pole and drew off. GIRL THIRSTY raced in the middle of the pack along the rail, moved up and into contention at the half mile pole, continued driving and angled out into the four path in the upper stretch and closed well getting up for second. MEDLEY was happy to take the lead and attend the pace along the rail, showed the way until the three eights pole where she tired. MISS KENNEDY raced even. AVERI EVER AFTER made no impact. OUR LITTLE GIRL was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Girl Thirsty
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, gained ground 1/2, angled out 1/4, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Polk
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L

ENTRY.NAME: Medley
ENTRY.OWNER: Heiligbrodt Corinne Heiligbrodt L William and Spendthrift Farm LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 16250. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 21, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.

CLAIM.OWNER: Day Perry and Foster Joseph M

RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHARP CHARLIE broke sharp, took the rail and lead the way, was the uncontested winner. BANKROLL stalked the leader from the three path, followed around the track and was second best today. GILDERSLEEVE raced from well off the pace, made one run gaining ground with each stride, saved ground on the rail early then shifted out five wide in the upper stretch and closed down the lane well getting up third. CHROMPTON was racing in the middle of the pack at first, was five wide, was asked at he half, gained ground while still being wide through the turn and mildly closed in the stretch. HEREWECOMETOGETYOU was off slow and made little impact. ONE TOUGH CHARLIE showed brief speed then faded. BRIMESTONE KID was no threat. MAGIC LIGHTNING was no menace. MY HEAVY SON was never involved. SOUTH AL SPARKY race to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Gildersleeve
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off the pace, rail, one run, shifted 5 wide, upper, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Sharp Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharp, led, rail, uncontested winner

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 7 1/2F Turf CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $25,000). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the t urf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SISTER SEEK went wire to wire. ATHENAIS was well off the pace early, started gaining ground and momentum at the half, saved ground and closed down the lane with a vengeance but just missed, ran a game second. CHARTREUSE raced from mid pack, launched a mild bid and closed well getting up for third. REGAL STANCE was far back ea, never hurried, was put into the race at the quarter pole closed well. HIGH DONNA stalked the early leaders, and faded. MO WANNA GO vied for the lead, set the pace and tire. MONTASTICAL raced even and tired late. REAUX BINA showed little. OLD SCHOOL FLASH was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Chartreuse
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, closed well, up for third

ENTRY.NAME: Regal Stance
ENTRY.COMMENT: was off the pace, closed late

ENTRY.NAME: Montastical
ENTRY.OWNER: Iapetus Racing Diamond T Racing and Alphin Richard
